Separate a character column into multiple columns based on a substring

Source: R/separate.R
pl_separate.Rd

Currently, splitting a column on a regular expression or position is not possible.

Usage

pl_separate(.data, col, into, sep = "[^[:alnum:]]+", remove = TRUE)

Arguments

.data

A Polars Data/LazyFrame

col

Column to split

into

Character vector containing the names of new variables to create. Use NA to omit the variable in the output.

sep

String that is used to split the column.

remove

If TRUE, remove input column from output data frame.

Examples

test <- polars::pl$DataFrame(
  x = c(NA, "x.y", "x.z", "y.z")
)
pl_separate(test, x, into = c("foo", "foo2"), sep = ".")
#> shape: (4, 2)
#> ┌──────┬──────┐
#> │ foo  ┆ foo2 │
#> │ ---  ┆ ---  │
#> │ str  ┆ str  │
#> ╞══════╪══════╡
#> │ null ┆ null │
#> │ x    ┆ y    │
#> │ x    ┆ z    │
#> │ y    ┆ z    │
#> └──────┴──────┘
